Participants.evidence: Setting: An academic medical canter specializing in the care of women and children.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomly allocated to three groups: a single-period TEAS group (Group S, n = 40), a multi-period TEAS group (Group M, n = 40) and a non-stimulation control group (Group C, n = 40).

Objective.evidence: Objective: To evaluate the efficacy of different periods for the prevention of postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) in patients undergoing gynecological laparoscopy with transcutaneous electrical acupoint stimulation (TEAS).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence and severity of PONV during the 48 h after surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Patients were randomly allocated to three groups.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 120 women were enrolled.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Patients were randomly allocated to three groups: a single-period TEAS group (Group S, n = 40), a multi-period TEAS group (Group M, n = 40) and a non-stimulation control group (Group C, n = 40).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Within postoperative 0–2 h, 4–12 h, group M had less frequency and lower scores for nausea compared with group C and group S had only less frequency of nausea compared with group C at 4–12 h postoperatively.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration: Chinese Clinical Trials Registry, No. ChiCTR2200065802, Registered 15/11/2022.
